I deeply regret choosing AIRA for my heat pump installation. From unclear payment terms to poor installation quality, the experience has been a nightmare.Unfair Payment Practices ‚Äì I was misled about the payment terms. I was led to believe I could spread over affordable terms only to later find out it was locked into 12 months‚Äîcompletely unaffordable for me. Despite raising this issue with AIRA they ignored my emails and are sending bailiffs to my property without responding. Shocking customer service.Substandard Installation ‚Äì The work done was completely unprofessional:Leaks caused water damage across two floors, breaking my shower pump. The boiler flue was left uncapped, causing further leaks during rainfall.7 out of 9 radiators were the wrong size, and only 2 were installed. The electrician was absent for 2 of the 5 days and left a mess, even using my child‚Äôs toy broom to dig up pebbles! Poor insulation and unsupported pipework, leading to heat loss before the system even enters the house. Lack of Accountability ‚Äì Despite multiple complaints, AIRA refuses to engage or resolve these issues. The quality of work is shocking for a company claiming to be a leader in renewable heating.I have since escalated my complaint to the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MCS), Renewable Energy Consumer Code (RECC), and the Financial Ombudsman due to unethical business practices and substandard installation.Avoid AIRA at all costs! They don‚Äôt care about their customers. If you value your home, your finances, and your sanity‚Äîgo elsewhere.

Had looked at several companies in relation to possibly changing from oil heating to an Air Source heat pump and have had 3 different quotes, 2 not miles apart but far more detailed in their approach than Aira less so and were by far more expensive. Thats not my reason for 1 star but more that when i first looked at them they advertised a 15 year guarantee included but actually its a 5 year guarantee and if you want a 15 year guarantee you have to pay a monthly fee on top of the purchase price to enable the guarantee. HIES will only back it with a 2 year insurance backed warranty so your relying on Aira being around for the full term when they have only been in the uk just over a year. The sales guy countered this by explaining that Aira was bankrolled by Vargas and was worth billions and having researched them to confirm it appears that another company they started is in financial difficulty. So i just dont have the confidence to use them. The sales guy couldnt confirm if radiators would need to be changed but added them to the quote, surely the should know but seemed to fall back on telling me the tech survey would confirm. So seems like the sales model is sell and we can make it fit. Hugely dissapointed too that they appear to have some kind of discount table they work from as when i mentioned i had had cheaper quotes they started to mention discounts for referring a friend and managers special and so on. It reminded me of the old style double glazing type salesman and even with the discounts it was still more expensive. On that basis i would not recommend Aira, too many red flags and they very much come across as a one size fits all and are making the most of the Boiler Upgrade Scheme and as we have seen many times before companies come and go very quickly, so cannot place my trust in them for such a new business. Very slick marketing that caught my eye but thats where it stops.

Everything was brilliant until it was fitted! Aftercare team is woeful! A month after it was fitted we had a leak caused by the engineer to which they dealt with at the time within a couple of hours but the damage that was caused has not been rectified and when they did send Joe Bloggs to come and paint the ceiling well‚Ä¶ put it this way Stevie Wonder could have done a better job!! The 2 chairs he took away to clean from the dirty water have lost the firmness and stains are still visible and the flooring wasn‚Äôt even considered yet the water made the floor soft and we‚Äôve had to change the flooring throughout the entire kitchen because of this!! Honestly been fobbed off so many times it‚Äôs appalling!

Avoid AIRA! The Technical personnel were competent but the rest were rather like the old ‚ÄòDouble Glazing‚Äô Companies strategy! (Despite the fact that this Company is a very recent entry into the UK Heat Pump market, I was interested enough to get a quote, knowing their business elsewhere.)The original ‚Äòquote‚Äô of around ¬£8,600 (after ¬£7,600 grant ) from the Salesman seemed on the high side but for their system and conditions, made a little sense so I accepted for the next stage, which was the survey by their professional surveyor. (The survey was only possible if you accepted the Salesman original quote and paid the fee - it took many phone calls to get confirmation that the ¬£99 was refundable if, for any reason, the work did not go ahead.)After the  survey the original Salemans Quote then increased by over 40%!!! (This increase included some items that the salesman has ticked as in the original quote, and yes, I still have that document.) Rather a shock! I did try and follow up to find out why there was such an increase, as I was still interested in their product, only to be met with excuses from the ‚ÄòSalesman‚Äôs Manager‚Äô that ‚Äòthe Salesman had made mistakes‚Äô or ‚Äòhe‚Äôd only been with them a short while‚Äô and that they‚Äôd ‚Äôspoken to him‚Äô - as if that was of any interest to me at all!! They obviously had more interest in looking after the salesman rather than their disappointment/miss-sold,  prospective customer! I still persevered and was promised my concern would be elevated and was  then offered ¬£200.00 off after the Salesman‚Äôs Manager had spoken to her boss! Obviously totally unacceptable!I still persevered (didn‚Äôt give up even then) and was promised my Quote and concerns would be elevated to an even more Senior Managers level by the a Salesmans Manager and she would call me back! I‚Äôm still waiting for that return phone call and, of course, have taken my Heat Pump journey elsewhere to a Company that cares and has proved very professional in all respects. There were two of us present at the start with the AIRA Salesman and made it very clear we wanted a complete ‚ÄòTurnkey Project‚Äô ie everything included and that‚Äôs what we were promised by the salesman!I have no doubt their equipment is fit for purpose, it‚Äôs a pity this is not echoed by the Sales Department of the Company.

We went with Aira for a number of reasons, there guarantee the time scale of 30 days to complete and the sales team that came out to quote.Unfortunately Aira have massively let us down and have now left us with no heating from July we are still without heating to this day with no response or support from Aira with an 18month old and my wife who is pregnant.We do have a complicated house which is a full renovation project, with no current heating system installed. At every stage from the initial quote to the technical I said are you sure you can take this on. Each person that came out said they could do it and it wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. We really wanted to get the heating in before the winter for obvious reasons. After a month of waiting for a date to start they came back to us and said there was a problem and they would have to re survey the house. Which they did, they said that the heat loss had gone from 13ish to 18ish. They took off a room that we said we were happy not to have heated. Oh and added ¬£ 10,000 to the price (so don‚Äôt believe there price guarantee) or we needed to add insulation to the external walls. We got a quote to have insulation added. However this time they said the price would be ¬£10,000 even with external wall insulation added to the property. And then to top it off they stopped contacting us all together.We are still without a heating system. I really wanted Aira to be fantastic. If you have a simple install that takes no real planning and is straight swap I‚Äôm sure they will be good for you. If you want a system that is optimal I would not go with Aira. I also would not trust them to support you if anything major goes wrong. I have never experienced a company that would just drop a customer like they have us.Edit to reply ‚ÄîI would love to see your call logs and email records where you contacted me during October. The last contact I had was from your reception team to say that they were closing my case. I explained that we were waiting for a call from Deepak as the plans had not been confirmed. She apologised and she would get Deepak to call. We are still awaiting that call.You did a second survey and initially said if we insulate we wouldn‚Äôt need a second heat pump. We got a quote for this and said we would insulate and then suddenly even with all walls being internally insulated and adding doors to separate rooms and even removing a room (conservatory) from the plans you still said we would need a second heat pump and to pay ¬£10,000. This would have meant the total install costing us close to ¬£30,000 with insulation and doors! You clearly didn‚Äôt want the job I have had a couple of quotes since from other heating engineers who have explained it is near impossible for the heat loss to jump that much and they have all come back with close to your original figure for heat loss.It really is a shame as we had high hopes for you as a company and I genuinely hope you can improve you processes. There are multiple reviews not just on here but across social media of people that have expanded what we have with you.

Schlechte Erfahrung mit AiraDie Entscheidung f√ºr die W√§rmepumpe von Aira fiel nicht zuletzt deshalb, weil uns der Aussendienst MA fest zusagte, dass die Montage nicht von Subunternehmern durchgef√ºhrt wird.Leider war dies nicht der Fall, die Anlage wurde mehr schlecht als recht von einer Fremdfirma Anfang Juli 2024 verbaut.Alle Installationsm√§ngel hier aufzuz√§hlen, w√ºrde den Rahmen sprengen.Es folgten viele Anrufe, E-Mails und Briefe bis am 20.09.2024 ein MA von Aira bei uns im Haus war, der wiedermal alle M√§ngel aufnahm.Er sagte uns fest zu, dass am n√§chsten Tag sich sein Vorgesetzter bei uns meldet, um den Ablauf der M√§ngelbeseitigung zu besprechen, was leider nicht passierte.Wir brachten uns wiedermal mit Anrufen, E-Mails und Einschreiben-R√ºckschein in Erinnerung, damit die Anlage endlich vertragsgem√§√ü fertiggestellt wird.Wie schon gewohnt...keine Reaktion.Das letzte Einschreiben mit Fristsetzung an die Zentrale in Berlin, im November 2024, wurde bei der Post hinterlegt und dort nicht abgeholt, es ging nach 4 Wochen an uns zur√ºck.Am 13.12.2024 hat sich ein MA gemeldet, der uns wiedermal bat alle M√§ngel aufzulisten, was aber bei Aira hinreichend bekannt ist.Auf unsere Nachfrage, ein paar Tage sp√§ter, wie es nun weitergeht, wie schon gewohnt...keine Reaktion .Wir hatten schon viele Handwerker in unserem Haus, aber wie bei Aira mit M√§ngelbeseitung und vertagsgem√§√üer Erf√ºllung umgegangen wird, ist schon sehr bemerkenswert.Heute nun der n√§chste H√∂hepunkt: eine Zahlungsaufforderung den noch ausstehenden Betrag binnen 5 Tagen zu bezahlen.Von der entg√ºltigen Fertigstellung der Anlage keine Rede.Wir sollen f√ºr eine Anlage, die nicht mal im Ansatz nach den Vertragsbedingungen fertig gestellt wurde, bezahlen!

We were really excited by AIRA technology, we knew we were working with a new company and their would be teething issues, but it has been one incompetence after another. The install technicians are fantastic even though it took three attempts whilst doing a house renovation. The pump looks great, its just a shame that the heat calculation report wasn't done properly so all the radiators we bought and installed do not heat our home efficiently to get up to temperature. We have spent thousands insulating and getting everything up to standard to allow this to work in a victorian terrace. They also suggested a smaller water tank which barely fills up one bath. It has been over a month since install and we have called almost everyday to try and resolve these issues. We are just passed from one customer service agent to another and never receive a call back from a designer. Even talking to managers gets us nowhere. They send out technicians who cannot fix design flaws or improve anything because the problem is with the design system for our home. The hot water tank currently takes 3 hrs to reheat so more than one person having a shower means it is only Luke warm. We really wish AIRA could get their act together and actually provide the guarantees they offer. They have been paid by BUS grant so as far as they are concerned its no loss to them and they don't seem to care about any of their guarantees as they have been paid.

Initial experience was good but it rapidly fell apart. Their communication was hopeless, random design changes, no one seemed to have a clue. Last straw was the third time someone promised faithfully to call me on an agreed date and failed to do so. I regret spending so much time trying in vain to help them get their act together. I emailed that I'd given up on them, said I would be happy discuss my experience so they could learn for the future, but no one called. Useless

I contacted Aira as i was planning a home extension and wanted to plan to include a heat pump at the same time. I was initially impressed by the call centre and the initial visit from the technician. Subsequently, once the build had started I contacted them to see if they could visit the site to ensure that all plumbing and electric work was appropriate before plastering and floor were installed (the alternative was that i would need to rip up my floors and walls after the fact to accommodate the heat pump). They refused saying they would only be able to assist after the renovation was complete which makes no sense as it was impossible for my contractor to install the plumbing and electrical works with no input from the installer. I explained this to the call centre and still was told point blank they could not assist with such a pre-site visit. I then contacted an alternative service provider and it has been a much simpler experience with detailed schematics of plumbing and electrical requirements being provided to my contractors AND a pre-site visit scheduled. Dont recommend Aira at all as they are all talk and no action!

The initial visit and plan was very good and we were in agreement. We received confirmation of installation for the 21st October. And then when the day came, nobody showed up. We chased it up and only then did they mention they were concerned there may be asbestos at our property. Something not mentioned on the two prior visits, nor ahead of our scheduled date. My partner and I both took our last week of annual leave for this date. Furthermore we put a huge deposit on a kitchen to be installed after aira did the work (with plans to put things where our old back boiler is), which now obviously can't happen. We've chased up again three times by email, and 5 times by phone, since the 21st October, to find out what's happening now. We've been arranging asbestos testing with a company who liase directly with Aira, and still haven't heard anything back from them either. We're no further along and nobody at aira, including the regional manager for Cambridge, seems to think it's their job to sort any of this out, we're in limbo.Avoid this company like the plague. I feel sick that we're paying our hard earned cash to this company.

I initially chose the AIRA heat pump for its sleek design, competitive price, market-leading 15-year warranty, and strong performance reviews. Installed in May 2024, I was optimistic about the benefits it would bring, but unfortunately, my experience since then has been far from ideal.The heat pump has encountered several issues. First, it failed to go into ‚Äúaway mode,‚Äù meaning it continued heating water even when I wasn‚Äôt at home. A leak soon followed, causing pressure to drop below 1 bar, and a series of minor problems required frequent visits from AIRA‚Äôs maintenance team. While the customer service (especially Angela) and maintenance staff have been superb, I am growing tired of needing support so frequently for a supposedly reliable system.The design itself has significant flaws. On several occasions, the app failed to communicate with the heat pump, and there‚Äôs no manual override system‚Äîa major oversight that limits control when there are connectivity issues. The external compressor had to be replaced because it was faulty. Since AIRA is only now establishing itself in the UK, assistance is mostly handled remotely from Sweden, but reaching their Swedish team is often challenging and time-consuming.One of the most frustrating issues has been the pump‚Äôs abnormal electricity consumption overnight. As mentioned by AIRA  in their reply, the issue has been resolved, and I appreciated the company's goodwill gesture towards addressing an issue I had with a radiator - an issue not caused by AIRA. While I appreciate the dedication of their customer service and maintenance teams, the unreliability and persistent technical issues with the AIRA heat pump have left me disappointed. The brand's commitment to excellent customer support is evident, but a dependable and well-designed product should be the foundation for any company‚Äôs reputation. UPDATE - 20 Dec. 2024: It seems the issues I previously experienced have now been resolved. However, I still believe the unit would greatly benefit from manual controls, and I find it puzzling that setting the heating on a timer isn‚Äôt currently an option. The AIRA support team has assured me this feature will be available soon. If everything functions smoothly in the coming months and the ability to schedule heating is introduced, I plan to update this review with an additional star.UPDATE - 24 Dec. 2024: The heat pump stopped working again. There's no way to communicate between the app and the unit. There's 12C in the house, and no one is picking up my calls from AIRA. Because it's Christmas Eve. Meryy X-Mas everyone.

I asked a question about how compliance was provided on social media and the company blocked me. Later, I contacted the live assistance and the personnel could not give me accurate answers and said 'self-employed people do not need an entity' and can be contracted with Ruul without having a company. This is wrong. I don't believe that this company knows about the legal requirements of freelancing at all. I was advised to invoice without an entity and it turns out that this is not legal. Self-employment does require corporation or some sort of tax registration.* Company still insists that self-employed can be contracted without having legal entities in its answer below and does not reply to my emails. I do not trust this provider and wouldn't recomment anyone to use this invoicing service. This looks like a total scam to me.

Ruul's bank account is not currectly linked and setup for bank-payments. My Bank (Rabobank), gives a message that the bank-info and beneficiary is not correctly listed. As a result they block the payment. I've asked Ruul to fix this, but that experience was all but professional. As a result you end up paying unnecessary creditcard fees (as you don't want your people to bear the consequences). Then customer service tells you there is no issue :-|. Hahaha. This company does not understand the impact poor performance of their service has on any business owner dealing with them. I would not recommend this service and will start looking into alternatives myself.

My experience with Ruul has been nothing but trouble. My client became unverified shortly after being verified, and had to be re-verified. Ruul then lost the money the client sent in the first two invoices, and seem to assume my client made a mistake, despite the client providing evidence from their bank that the money was transferred. I have been providing unpaid services for two months now, because my client no longer wants to pay invoices from Ruul. I have to open up a support ticket every single time I use the platform. I work in tech. Ruul is not user-friendly, and often breaks. Losing the money was the final straw. I‚Äôm closing my account, and would encourage others to look elsewhere.

Absolutely horrible service experience so far. Invoiced my client, and sent out everything, they wire-transferred the money to Ruul and everything stopped here. We waited days and days, but nothing happened. I contacted customer support, they contacted their finance department which said they didn't get the money, nothing they can do.Another day passed, contacted customer support again, finally they get in contact with their own bank, who said (presumably) they didn't receive any money. Went back and forth with my client, and we ended up calling my client's bank together, they checked the transaction immediately and as it turns out, the transaction was rejected and refunded.Ruul's bank sent back the money to my client (my client lost 25 euros in the process for a 150 euro invoice) Ruul's story is obviously different, their bank "tells a different story" and nothing really happened. I can't invoice my client and get paid, my client lost 25 euros for currency exchange fees by Ruul's bank, and seemingly this cannot be solved.Not recommended service at all. There are many alternatives, with much better customer support and without these weird banking issues. As for now, this seems more like a scam than an actual service to be honest.

Initial sale and communication was good, but follow up on the design and questions I have had has been slow to non-existent. Telephonic conversations with design engineers have been good, but promised follow ups in those conversations have not happened and I have had to chase numerous times to get them to do what they have promised. I have asked once that my complaints get escalated which I was told it would be, but have not had confirmation that it has been escalated and if it has been escalated no one has contacted me about it.I have now been allocated to a new design engineer, but it seems as though the handover was not done properly and several items discussed with the previous engineer was not taken into account by the new engineer. As an example my new design includes underfloor heating flow calculations even though my underfloor heating is electric. The radiator sizes agreed with previous engineer has also not been updated by the new engineer.Lastly communication about the installation date and process has been very poor. I have had conflicting messages from different team members about the need for planning permission. It seems as though planning permission is needed, but I have no idea whether this has been submitted or when it will be submitted. A client work flow and progress tracking app or Web page would be really helpful. In the absence of that a single point of contact would be really helpful as at the moment it feels as though I am sending emails into a black hole and hoping for some kind of response.

Planung und BeratungDie Planung und Beratung verliefen insgesamt sehr gut. Besonders positiv hervorzuheben ist, dass w√§hrend der Beratung gezielt auf meine W√ºnsche eingegangen wurde, wie zum Beispiel die Integration eines Unitowers mit Warmwasserspeicher.Probleme beim InstallationsterminAm ersten vereinbarten Installationstermin, der f√ºr die Gartenlandschaftsarbeiten angesetzt war, erschien leider niemand ‚Äì und das ohne jegliche vorherige Information. Ich hatte extra Urlaub genommen. Als Konsequenz habe ich f√ºr die verbleibenden Tage in Absprache mit meinem Arbeitgeber auf Homeoffice umgestellt.Zus√§tzlich wurden in der Woche vor dem Installationstermin pl√∂tzlich mehrere Pakete bei uns angeliefert. Da wir zu diesem Zeitpunkt im Urlaub waren und keine Vorank√ºndigung erhalten hatten, lagen diese Pakete eine Woche ungesichert vor unserer Haust√ºr.√Ñnderungen ohne R√ºckspracheNach der Demontage der alten Heizung bemerkten die Elektriker, die einen Tag nach den Heizungsbauern eintrafen, dass anstelle des geplanten Unitowers andere Ger√§te im Heizkeller installiert wurden. Dies f√ºhrte zu erheblicher Verwirrung, da es sich herausstellte, dass die Planerin den Auftrag eigenm√§chtig umgeplant hatte, ohne uns dar√ºber zu informieren. W√§hrend das Team der Heizungsbauer bereits den neuen Installationsplan umsetzte, arbeiteten die Elektriker noch nach den urspr√ºnglichen Pl√§nen, die den Unitower vorsahen. Nach R√ºcksprache mit den Installateuren und der Zusicherung, dass die alternativen Komponenten (andere Inneneinheit, 300-Liter-Warmwasserspeicher und 100-Liter-Pufferspeicher) die gleiche Effizienz erreichen w√ºrden, stimmte ich schlie√ülich dem Einbau der neuen Ger√§te zu. Es wurde jedoch auch darauf hingewiesen, dass ein Unitower nicht bestellt worden sei und fr√ºhestens in vier Wochen verf√ºgbar w√§re.Qualit√§t der Arbeit und weitere ProblemeW√§hrend das Team der Elektriker professionell arbeitete und vieles mit mir abstimmte, hinterlie√üen die Heizungsinstallateure leider einen weniger guten Eindruck. Es w√ºrde den Rahmen sprengen, hier alle Details aufzuf√ºhren, aber um es kurz zu fassen: Es herrschte eine eher lockere Atmosph√§re, die nicht immer f√∂rderlich f√ºr die Arbeitsqualit√§t war. Als ich bemerkte, dass eine Kiste Bier im Firmenwagen der Heizungsinstallateure mitgef√ºhrt wurde, wurde deutlich, dass hier f√ºr "gute Stimmung" gesorgt war, was jedoch den professionellen Eindruck weiter tr√ºbte.Nach etwa einer Woche war die W√§rmepumpe installiert, jedoch funktionierte au√üer der Warmwasserbereitung nichts. Die Heizung war nicht entl√ºftet, der Vor- und R√ºcklauf der Heizungsrohre waren vertauscht, und die Zirkulationspumpe war nicht angeschlossen worden. Diese M√§ngel wurden bei einem sp√§teren Termin behoben. Leider stie√ü ich beim Versuch, diese Probleme zu kommunizieren, auf Unverst√§ndnis seitens des Supports, der mich eher als √ºberempfindlichen Kunden behandelte, obwohl sowohl Vorlauf als auch R√ºcklauf kalt waren.Ein weiteres Problem war, dass der sogenannte ‚Äûerweiterte hydraulische Abgleich‚Äú nie richtig durchgef√ºhrt wurde. Zwar wurden die entsprechenden Werte unterschrieben, jedoch nicht tats√§chlich eingestellt.Fortlaufende SchwierigkeitenLeider setzten sich die Probleme fort. Sp√§ter stellte sich heraus, dass die Zonen auf die falschen Heizkreise programmiert waren und die Sensoren f√§lschlicherweise am R√ºcklauf statt am Vorlauf angebracht wurden. Diese Fehler lie√üen sich schneller selbst beheben, als zwei weitere Wochen auf eine Reaktion des Supports zu warten.Unvollst√§ndige AbrechnungTrotz dieser M√§ngel wurde die Rechnung bereits gestellt, obwohl die Entsorgung der alten Anlage noch nicht abgeschlossen war. Zudem sollten urspr√ºnglich noch weitere Radiatoren installiert werden, was die Planerin jedoch nicht eingeplant hatte. Dies f√ºhrte dazu, dass die finale Rechnungskorrektur noch einige Zeit in Anspruch nahm.FazitTrotz der Schwierigkeiten und Verz√∂gerungen war das Preis-Leistungs-Verh√§ltnis am Ende zufriedenstellend, und die W√§rmepumpe funktioniert mittlerweile einwandfrei. Ich kann jedoch nur jedem empfehlen, sich im Vorfeld gr√ºndlich zu informieren und die Arbeiten genau zu √ºberwachen.

Most of the work was fitted quickly and nicely. However it's been nearly a month since it's been done and we're still missing a radiator that has been ordered twice, with no communication even though we've called about it. I have been researching heat pumps for a while and decided to go ahead in May.  I had to wait until September as the Aira 12kw heat pump was only coming available then. The process of getting everything arranged was a lot more difficult than advertised with almost no communication coming from Aira (I later found out ‚Äúit looks like you may not have got our emails‚Äù, although all the ones to ensure payment seemed to get through).  On Monday the team turned up to install the heat pump. First problem, they had a Vaillant heat pump that had a much shorter warranty - I had been won over by 15 years on the Aira heat pump. Apparently I had been emailed a design with the changed heat pump (I had not) and because I didn‚Äôt reply it was assumed I had agreed with the change. I was given the choice of accepting the switch or waiting weeks to get the one I had ordered. The team who were on site to install were brilliant. They went out of their way to explain everything and to keep my informed on progress. Unfortunately they were not helped by the team in the office who seemed to make every effort to make things difficult. For example:The design that I had ‚Äúapproved‚Äù by not replying to the email I didn‚Äôt receive had completely missed our kitchen / dining room (a large room with a large bifold and a partial glass roof) - marking it as ‚Äúunheated‚Äù so not needing any additional radiator capacitySending me someone else‚Äôs design (I have still not seen my own)Sending the wrong radiators and not sending some at allDiverting the team from installation work to drive about 100 miles to the depot to pick up a different buffer tank as the wrong one was sent. Taking members of the team off to do other work when they were needed here. Despite being assured we would not be without hot water or heat overnight at any point during the process, the team very reluctantly told me they would not be able to finish the work within the planned 5 days. I said this was annoying but could see it was not their fault. I asked if they would be back on Saturday. They said no and that they didn‚Äôt know when the job would be finished. Needless to say I have had no communication from Aira head office. I tried to contact them by phone but was told that everyone who could help was out of the office and I should call back on Monday.  I made it very clear that this was not a great outcome. So.. I am left without heat for at least 3 nights and no idea if / when the work that has now gone a long way past the point of no return will be completed. If I had known what I know now I would never have gone ahead with this project. I am furious. I suspect this is a reflection of a relatively new company suffering growing pains but it is utterly unacceptable. I am hoping someone might take the initiative and call me but nothing yet.

Damit konnte man sehen, wieviel man verbraucht hat, um ggf. sein Verhalten anzupassen. Aira bietet solche Informationen nicht. Man hat also keine Ahnung. Jeder, der ein Gleichungssystem mit 2 Unbekannten l√∂sen kann, wird feststellen, das die Werte komplett unrealistisch sind.Angeblich soll die W√§rmepumpe eine SG-Ready-Schnittstelle zur Anbindung an eine PV-Anlage haben.Bis heute gibt es jedoch hierzu keine Dokumentation.Daher bin ich nicht sicher, ob diese existiert.-unzuverl√§ssigDie WP ging aus unerfindlichen Gr√ºnden irgendwann in den Dauerbetrieb. Wir haben  ca. 60 kWh pro Tag verbraucht.Wir haben die Hotline angerufen. Nach ein paar Tastendr√ºcken, hat irgendwo ein Telefon geklingelt, das niemand abnahm. Immerhin, nach einigen Stunden hat jemand zur√ºckgerufen, um uns einfach zu sagen, dass uns jemand kontaktieren wird. Das ist dann wiederum nicht geschehen. Im Dauerbetrieb l√§uft die WP inzwischen nicht mehr. Warum wissen wir nicht.Lt. PL l√§ge das noch an den fehlenden Zonenreglern.Trotzdem der Heizbetrieb nicht verf√ºgbar ist, wurden w√§hrend des Dauerbetriebs 2 R√§ume trotz ausgeschaltetem Raumthermostat stark geheizt. Alle anderen R√§ume jedoch nicht.Und nun zum Marketingsprech von Aira:- Komfortgarantie:Wenn es unter 20 Grad im Haus ist, kommt jemand vorbei. So hei√üt es. Es gibt auch keine Analyse warum 2 R√§ume geheizt wurden.Wir haben nun gr√∂√üere Mengen Holz f√ºr einen funktionierenden Kamin bestellt, um irgendwie durch den Winter zukommen.Kommende Woche soll uns wieder mal jemand kontaktieren. I don't want to be writing this review, but I've been chasing Aira for months (Since the instal in mid-May '24) regarding the thermostat that apparently was stuck in customs. This hasn't been a problem through the summer when it's not been needed, it's getting colder now and the unit thinks that it's nice and toasty in my house when it certainly is not. This is going to be a real issue when I have a new baby in a month or two and no way to heat my house over winter.The app/system is severely lacking functionality, I've written them a thorough email on what I feel it could do with adding/amending as it's my area of business so hopefully that'll be helpful in future. Haven't heard back from them regarding that email however.The install team were great, everyone was friendly and careful and tidied up after them and stayed late on, the kit is also the prettiest I've seen out there, though it does seem like they put the external unit's base down backwards as it's not quite lined up properly and is a lot higher off the ground than all the other images of their units I've seen.It's just this thermostat issue and the poor app. I really want Aira to succeed in the market, but they've got to be better at communicating what's happening.I also constantly get errors on the unit through the app that I have to restart the power for the internal unit to resolve. I'm hopeful this is just a software issue or due to the lack of thermostat but it's getting ridiculous now.

Don't be fooled by the 5* reviews given after the intro sales chats, this is a full review after a real installation.I hate leaving negative reviews and airing dirty laundry in public, but it‚Äôs been a couple of months of chasing Aira for resolutions and things just aren‚Äôt moving.Went with these guys for an install back in April. Good, competitive price - cheaper than Octopus - I suspect due to the amount of investment money being pumped into the company at the moment. In theory the 10 year guarantee sounds appealing, but I knew there‚Äôs always the risk of the company going bust. I got a guaranteed SCOP which was promising, but more on that later.The install week was okay. 5 guys who were new to the company turned up with one lead engineer who knew his stuff. Mostly professional although there was damage to my house which still hasn‚Äôt been resolved. The pipework and cabling could have been a lot neater, and I didn‚Äôt feel that well consulted on what was going where on my external walls, so now it looks a little messy.However, the aftercare and follow up post install have been horrendous which makes me question how long this company is going to last.Since the install, I‚Äôve had to chase them to invoice me, and I‚Äôve repeatedly asked why the system isn‚Äôt performing up to the guaranteed SCOP‚Ä¶ even in the warmer seasons. I‚Äôve not had any concrete response on either the damage caused - a leak through my ceiling and various damage to paintwork and my patio, which I‚Äôve had to clean myself, or the fact the system just isn‚Äôt performing.Maybe others will have a better experience than I‚Äôve had as the company matures, but I took a gamble with this company which doesn‚Äôt seem to be paying off.Bottom line, the heat pump (Vaillant) is great and the COP is fair to middling. The house gets warm. However the efficiency could be better. The install was messy - nice guys for sure - but the aftercare is a total shambles. If I did this again I‚Äôd go for a smaller, Heat Geek certified local installer as neither Octopus, British Gas or Aira seem to have the attention to detail or sight of the bigger picture that satisfying customers is going to be the catalyst that drives the heat pump revolution.Aira - you have my number.

I used the customer support chat and was contacted by Onur. I had trouble aligning Ruul's service with my country's local laws and tax obligations, which is why I decided to ask some questions about it. After the first few messages, Onur failed to answer my concerns directly and instead replied with semi-relevant messages which seemed to be pre-written. Because of that, I tried to word my questions more specifically, which was met by several passive-aggressive responses, also not particularly answering my questions. The conversation ended with Onur telling me not to worry about my concerns without actually telling me why. Later, upon further, individual research, I found out that the information he gave me was most likely false. I understand if there are certain matters customer supporters are unable to answer, especially if they regard local regulations, however, in that case, I expect a response to reflect exactly that instead of vague and evasive answers.

I'm sad that we won't be proceeding with Aira, following the surveys, and difficulty getting a full and final quote without committing to buy in advance. Aira's product and guarantees look really great but I think the company is too young in the UK, with immature internal processes, challenges with scaling technical teams, challenges with customer service responsiveness, and the app and thermostat also lack functionality at the moment. I'm sure these issues will be resolved in time but I don't feel like subjecting myself to that many risks for such an important purchase.

We were very pleased with our initial telephone conversation and with the visit from Gabriel to assess our property would be necessary. At that visit we were told that, because the heat exchanger could be fitted more than 1 m away from the property boundary, we would not need planning permission even with the larger heat pump. This would mean that the installation could be done in February. This was good news as we are going on holiday towards the end of March and would like some time to check out, get used to and ask any questions about the new system. We were therefore very disappointed to hear on the telephone two days later that installation in February would require planning permission and therefore installation will be done in March and we were given the date of 10th of March to start the work which is likely to take 4 to 5 days. This means we will only have two weeks experience with the system before we go on holiday which is a pity. We have asked that this issue of planning commission doublechecked. We still have total confidence that this is an excellent system and that the work will be carried out to exceptionally high standards but this was a slight disappointment as you can understand.

Spoke with the salesman who was excellent.Received a good preliminary quote.Paid ¬£99 for the survey.The surveyor turned up, moaned a bit about how the house wasn‚Äôt suitable, refused to listen to what we are doing to make it suitable. Made a call to moan to someone in the company about whether he should just leave. Was told by them to take the data and they work on it. The equipment they used for that was great, very high technology. The guy left.Since then, no survey, no communication. If they had sent a survey including the problems then I could have told the person performing the analysis what is happening to the house and they could have accounted for it.Given the current waiting time in the industry between quote and the work being performed, it‚Äôs not unreasonable to get a quote at the same time you‚Äôre speaking with joiners about insulation else to get the joinery done before they perform the survey, we‚Äôll be waiting a year for installation.Would give them more stars but ultimately, for me the time and money has lead to absolutely nothing.Needless to say, we‚Äôve accepted a quote from someone else.Edit:I have since spoken with people at Aira who have listened and taken on board my criticism. Essentially, there‚Äôs been a communication breakdown. I expect that the company will make efforts to improve this and to talk with their prospective clients more proactively.They are refunding the ¬£99 survey fee - thank you.Edit 2 post Aira reply:Please note above where I said the surveyor refused to listen to what we are doing to make the house suitable. We will be insulating where required and fitting larger radiators, the work starts in January.Most British houses are not ready for a straight replacement from a gas / oil boiler to an ASHP without new radiators and maybe some additional insulation. It is ludicrous to presume that the house must be ASHP ready before your survey as that should form part of the ‚Äòwhat needs to be done‚Äô process, or am I supposed to guess what size radiators are required for each room (I am an engineer, I don‚Äôt guess where I can calculate)? This is perfectly reasonable given the current lead time for installation of an ASHP. Plus, our installation is deliberately scheduled for March so we have several months to make any final changes before the heating is required in earnest.As for our house is not suitable, yes, right now it‚Äôs not but that‚Äôs why we don‚Äôt have an ASHP right now. It will be suitable and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre getting one installed.

3 oder nur 2 Sterne? Da Warmwasserbereitung und Heizung zwischenzeitlich grunds√§tzlich funktionieren und ich wohlwollend bewerten m√∂chte, hab ich mich f√ºr 3 Sterne entschieden. Die Vielzahl der bei meinem Vorhaben aufgetretenen M√§ngel und Probleme erlaubt es mir leider nicht, eine bessere Bewertung abzugeben.Die Entscheidung f√ºr Aira erfolgte vor allem aufgrund der zugesagten langen Garantie- und Wartungsleistungen. Beauftragt  wurde eineVaillant-W√§rmepumpe VWL 55/6 in Kombination mit einem Vaillant-Unitower.Was lief gut- alle Besch√§ftigten hatten ein freundliches Auftreten.- Planung, Aufma√ü, "technical Design" lief - soweit ich das beurteilen kann - gut. Ich wei√ü allerdings nicht, ob in diesem Zusammenhang eineRohrnetzberechnung durchgef√ºhrt wurde - dazu sp√§ter mehr.- Galabauer und Elektriker haben gut gearbeitet.- die Abmeldung des Gasanschlusses beim Netzbetreiber hat einwandfrei undz√ºgig funktioniert.- der F√∂rderservice hat bis jetzt (F√∂rderung ist noch nicht "durch") gut funktioniert und auftretende Fragen schnell und kompetent beantwortet.- Die Hotline war zwar nicht immer sofort zu erreichen, hat jedoch immer schnell zur√ºckgerufen. Die Kollegen dort (am meisten hatte ich mit Nikolausund Niklas zu tun) sind freundlich und machen einen guten Job. Zumindest in der Bauphase h√§tte ich mir trotzdem einen telefonisch erreichbaren, direkten Ansprechpartner gew√ºnscht.Was lief nicht gutOffenbar steht und f√§llt der Erfolg eines solchen Bauvorhabens mit der Qualifikation und Erfahrung der ausf√ºhrenden Kollegen. Meine Heizung wurde von zwei sehr jungen Kollegen aufgebaut, die - wie ich sp√§ter erfahren habe - noch nie einen Unitower aufgebaut haben und auch ansonsten wohl noch Erfahrungen sammeln m√ºssen. Dies zeigte sich an etlichen w√§hrend des Bauvorhabens aufgetretenen Fehlern und M√§ngeln. Alle hier aufzuf√ºhren, w√ºrde den Rahmen sprengen, daher nur beispielhaft- fehlerhafter Anschluss der Zirkulationsleitung (mittels Abzweig von der Warmwasserleitung, da zirkuliert dann morgens das kalte Wasser...),- Zirkulationspumpe in unzul√§ssiger Einbaulage eingebaut,- Sicherheitsgruppe bzw. Tropfventil nicht an Abfluss angeschlossen Die vorgenannten M√§ngel sind nicht "von selbst" aufgefallen, sondern mussten von mir aktiv beanstandet werden.- das "Highlight" in negativer Hinsicht war sicherlich ein vor dem Verpressen √ºbersehener Stopfen im Heizkreis. Die Behebung dieses Fehlers hat (vor allem aufgrund der Fehlersuche) den Abschluss des Bauvorhabens um etwa eine Woche verz√∂gert (zum Gl√ºck konnte ich das mit Urlaub und Homeoffice abdecken),- zur Abnahme wurden die notwendigen Volumenstr√∂me an den Heizkreisverteilern nicht erreicht.Die aufgez√§hlten Fehler sind zwischenzeitlich behoben.Auch die nach Heizlastberechnung erforderlichen Volumenstr√∂me konnten k√ºrzlich von einem anderen Kollegen an den Heizkreisverteilern - gerade so- eingestellt werden. Allerdings str√∂mt im normalen Heizbetrieb eine (vermutlich geringe) Wassermenge direkt vom Vorlauf √ºber das √úberstr√∂mventil in den R√ºcklauf (durch Zischen des Ventils feststellbar), obwohl das Ventil bereits auf Anschlag (350mbar) eingestellt ist und alle Heizkreise offen sind. Laut Heizungsbauer sei das so in Ordnung. Das bezweifle ich stark, nach meiner laienhaften Einsch√§tzung liegt das eher an der Nutzung einer (bauseits vorhandenen, jedochurspr√ºnglich nicht f√ºr den Heizungsvor- und R√ºcklauf vorgesehenen) im Querschnitt vermutlich deutlich zu d√ºnnen Leitung zwischen Unitower und Heizkreisverteilern (Rohrnetzberechnung?). Wie lange das so wohl funktionieren mag?Vor allem dies f√ºhrt dazu, dass sich bei mir keine volle Zufriedenheit mit der geleisteten Arbeit sowie der Heizung an sich einstellen kann.Der Vollst√§ndigkeit halber erw√§hne ich noch, dass- w√§hrend der gut zweiw√∂chigen Bauzeit das Treppenhaus und vor allem die in den Keller f√ºhrende Treppe (Holzstufen) besch√§digt wurde. Die Treppe wurde nicht abgedeckt. In die Bewertung lasse ich dies jedoch nicht einflie√üen, da ich mich hierzu mit der Firma Aira geeinigt habe,- eine lange vor Baubeginn abgesprochene kleine Zusatzleistung (es sollte u.a. ein zus√§tzlicher, bauseits vorhandener Kugelhahn eingebaut werden) leider nicht durchgef√ºhrt wurde.

Saw them at Everything Thing Electric show. So far I have deducted 2 stars. One for cancelling the pre booked home visit for a heat survey / quotation. Lady who planned to visit somehow knew on the Thursday that she would be sick the following Monday. Second star deducted as when you called 30 mins after confirming the visit and then called back to postpone and rebook, I pointed out that I was on a train and it would be more convenient if you called back on Monday‚Ä¶.. which you never have. That was a week ago and not heard from you since. If you can‚Äôt get the basics of customer service right then I am not sure you are the company for me to invest any further time or my money with.

Heat pump installed and commissioned on 4th October. Communicating poorly at times, phone calls not returned and staff not knowing who‚Äôs dept is responsible. James was booked to carry out our initial viewing but didn't show up, tried to contact him both by phone and message to rebook but no reply back. A month later finally got the viewing completed and price agreed (no hard sell). Tech survey completed a few weeks later and cost of system reduced due to originally 6 radiators required changing now only 2.The installation team (Paul, Billy and Ashley) were fantastic, polite and prompt, nothing was too much trouble, a real asset to the company. System is performing well, still waiting for the Aira zero invite link email.

Got the job done.-------------------When reading my comments below bear in mind...1. Aira are very new to the UK, their processes are still immature and their supplier relationships are also developing.2. Our heat pump requirements were quite unusual and demanding as we live in a detached 1850s house with some stone walls. We had an unusually large (12kw) unit installed which required planning permission (but this was granted within a few weeks)3. we have only properly tested the hot water part of the solution. We will only really know if the heating works when winter comes.No go on Solar‚Äî-----------------At the outset we wanted a complete solar, battery and heat pump solution from one supplier. Unfortunately Aira were unable to execute on their solar and battery aspect. They could not get their partner solar supplier to provide us with the necessary technical details we needed to check the solution would work for us, so we abandoned that side of the project.Good expertise on Heat Pumps‚Äî---------------------------------------On the heat pump side we had good engagement from their expert designers who provided detailed heat loss and radiator calculations for us to check. It took a few iterations but we are now pretty confident we have a good design which will work come winter.Immature Radiator Supplier Relationship‚Äî--------------------------------------------When the week of the install came, we were four radiators short due to problems with the radiator supplier, and were missing a minor part for the external unit. Aira did manage to provide a working system which produced hot water though.Poor internal processes‚Äî-------------------------As far as customer service goes we had a very helpful customer service person (Angela) who responded quickly to all our issues. Unfortunately the organisation behind her did not always manage to deliver on her promises when they said they would. We also did not get a sense of anyone managing our project - we had to constantly call to move things on.There appeared to be a lack of internal communication within the company. On several occasions we had engineers turn up not knowing what they were due to fix and therefore missing a part or not having space in their vans to remove surplus kit. So an install which was due to complete on 26th July took a further month completing on 26th August.Recommended none-the-less‚Äî-------------------------------I suspect a more standard heat pump solution would have been a smoother process and I would definitely recommend Aira to anyone considering a heat pump solution, the individuals we dealt with were knowledgeable and worked to a good standard. They were all committed to delivering a good solution, which they did eventually.Advice to future customers‚Äî----------------------------As with any heat pump project the technology is new (to the UK at least) and can be complex so be sure to1. check the design carefully2. consider carefully where all the equipment and pipework is going to be located well in advance. There is a lot of it and it can be hard to hide.3. Be patient, it is a complex install.I was teetering between 3 and 4 stars as I am not sure any other company would have done a better job, given the complexity of our install. Eventually decided on 3 as I felt I ended up doing the project management rather than Aira being pro-active.

Gute Organisation!Am 10.06. zu Baubeginn, wurden uns morgens verschiedene Teile geliefert, ein Teil kam Mittags per Post bei uns an, w√§hrend bereits unsere alte Heizung deinstaliert wurde.Technische Ausf√ºhrung unvollst√§ndig!Bis zum heutigen Tag fehlen Unterlagen, im Sicherungskasten sollten laut der Firma noch √Ñnderungen vorgenommen werden. Inzwischen haben wir August! Das Team war f√ºr uns eine Zumutung!!!Teilweisen waren 15 Personen bei uns Zugange, die werder auf den Dreck, der durch das st√§ndige rein und raus mitreingeschleppt wurde, achteten, noch bei der Benutzung unseres WC (es war schlimmer als auf jeder √∂ffentlichen Toilette) R√ºcksicht nahmen. Die Haust√ºr schien keine Klinke zu haben, die T√ºr fiel st√§nig heftig zu, sodass die W√§nde wackelten, w√§hrend wir versuchten derweil unserer Arbeit nachzugehen.Auf einem Rohbau mag das alles kein Problem sein, aber eine solche Truppe in ein bewohntes Haus zu schicken, war eine Herausforderung.Von dem t√§glichen abendlichen Putzen, das WC halbwegs wieder nutzen zu k√∂nnen, abgesehen, mischten sich unter das Team, ganz unbemerkt Schrotth√§ndler, die dann Teile der alten Heizung hinausschleppten.Nach Beendigung der Arbeiten gab es im Flur, auf der Kellertreppe sowie im Keller selbst einige Sch√§den zu verzeichnen, die nun f√ºr uns eine Renovierung nach sich ziehen.Daf√ºr sieht sich die Firma jedoch nicht verantwortlich.

I'm still very interested in pursuing ASHP installation at my home, but not sure whether I am waiting to be contacted by Aira about next steps or supposed to be getting on with things (e.g. additional loft insulation) myself. Things currently feel a bit disjointed.

Dal preventivo alla realizzazione di tutto l impianto con la pdc in sole due settimane comprensivo di sopralluogo da parte del commerciale Franco.Un particolare ringraziamento a Michael e Malick che in soli tre giorni hanno installato la pec con professionalit√† lasciando il cantiere ben pulito e in ordine.Ho provato anche il servizio assistenza il sabato mattina e mi hanno ricontattato il sole due ore.Un ringraziamento anche a Alice e Marco del supporto tecnico.Non mi resta che attendere per vedere i consumi effettivi.Saluti a tutti

After weeks of research and getting quote for the installation of a heat pump system, I settled on exploring the options offered by Aira.  After placing a request on line I was contacted the following day to agree on a date and time to be visited by a sales person.  This was then arranged for a few days later.  The sales person arrived a little later than had been agreed  but had called ahead to explain so all was good.   The sales person then proceeded to give us some history about the company which was then followed by products on offer.  I was already familiar with most of the info due to researching prior  however it was good to go over it again for the benefit of my husband.  After that point, the salesperson surveyed our property and proposed a system including potential sites within the property for the various units that  would be installed and would potentially work well for us and maximise efficiency.  The sales person was knowledgeable and was able to answer any questions raised.  After agreeing on the quote we were advised that we would be called later that day to set up an date and time for the technical surveyor.  We didn't have too long to wait as an hour later we received a call and a time was scheduled for 2 days later. The Technical Surveyor arrived on time and quickly set to work reviewing the property.  It became apparent very quickly that that the proposed plan and design discussed 2 days  previously was just not going to work due to the property layout,  space, and  with the prospect of a decrease in efficiency.  The Technical Surveyor was very thorough in their review explaining regulations that needed to be adhered to which determined what would be possible.   An alternative option was proposed which involved having the pump on the front of the house which I was not a great fan of as well as as being apprehensive to the potential source of contention with our sound sensitive neighbours.  As a result, we are not proceeding with the installation.  Whilst this has not worked out for us on this occasion, I still would have no problems in recommending Aira.  I was assured by the quality of their product,  the  comfort guarantee offered  as well as the maintenance plan which is free for  the first year of installation.

Wir haben uns von Anfang bis Ende gut betreut gef√ºhlt. Auch wenn unerwartete Schwierigkeiten auftraten, wurde schnell eine L√∂sung gefunden. Wir haben einen sehr netten, kompetenten und zuverl√§ssigen Ansprechpartner.

Wegen meiner 35-Jahre alten Gasheizung und der noch bestehenden F√∂rderung habe ich mich kurzfristig f√ºr den Einbau einer W√§rmepumpe durch AIRA entschieden. Nach dem Besuch einer Info-Veranstaltung wurde ich zu Hause durch Herrn Saygin ausf√ºhrlich √ºber die Vertragsgestaltung und den Einbau informiert. Kritische R√ºckfragen wurden beantwortet. Auch ein direktes Gespr√§ch in der Zentrale vor Ort in Berlin trug zur Kl√§rung von Fragen bei. √úberzeugt hat mich (neben dem Preis) die gr√ºndliche raumweise Heizlastberechnung und die √úbermittlung der detaillierten Ergebnisse. Mitbewerber wollten die WP nach Verbrauch dimensionieren und kamen zu v√∂llig anderen Ergebnissen.Der Einbau der 8-KW-WP konnte eine Woche nach Angebotserstellung beginnen. Von der Materialanlieferung am 2.12.24 bis zur √úbergabe der Anlage am 5.12. verlief alles reibungslos. Der zust√§ndige Meister, Herr G√∂vert, koordinierte alle Gewerke und war immer ansprechbar. Ich m√∂chte mich bei ihm und seinem Team aber auch bei den Mitarbeitern im Hintergrund (technisches Design, F√∂rderung) f√ºr die geleistete Arbeit herzlich bedanken.Abzug eines Sterns:Die R√§ume mit Fu√übodenheizung (30 %) und mit Heizk√∂rpern werden gut beheizt. Die R√§ume mit HK sind in der Gr√∂√üe (20, 35 qm), in der Nutzung (Kamin abends) und in der Entfernung (Gartenhaus) sehr unterschiedlich. Ein Raumthermostat allein kann diese Unterschiede nicht abbilden, so dass die R√§ume nicht gleichm√§√üig beheizt werden. Auch die Festlegung eines Referenzraumes f√ºhrt noch nicht zu den gew√ºnschten Ergebnissen. Die Einstellm√∂glichkeiten √ºber die App sind sehr begrenzt, aber das ist wohl gewollt. Es sind wohl noch weitere zentrale Softwareanpassungen geplant. Zu loben ist der Service, der bisher versucht hat, auf die bestehenden Probleme zu reagieren.Hans-Ulrich L√ºbge, Berlin

Sono stato ‚Äúobbligato‚Äù dalla corrosione del tubo del gas in  giardino (e stop all'erogazione) e  quindi dai costi da affrontare per sostituirlo,  a fare il passaggio dal gas alla pompa di calore, macchina che gi√† da tempo mi frullava in testa come idea per il risparmio energetico e la sostenibilit√†. Nella mia casa ho gi√† l‚Äôimpianto fotovoltaico da 16 anni e in cucina utilizzo da tempo l‚Äôinduzione quindi il passaggio a tutto elettrico √® stato una  naturale conseguenza.Brevi i tempi intercorsi tra offerta e realizzazione.La sostituzione della caldaia a gas con l‚Äôimpianto pompa di calore √® stata fatto dalla squadra composta da Vittorio Vincenzo Edoardo e Simone . Il lavoro √® stato effettuato in tre giorni in modo professionale  e pulito. L‚Äôimpianto √® acceso dal 5 dicembre, la casa era fredda gi√† da 15 giorni: all‚Äôinizio i consumi sono stati alti ed ora (20 dicembre) si sono abbastanza stabilizzati; i miei caloriferi in ghisa fanno fatica a riscaldare mediamente bene tutta la casa con consumi accettabili: sto monitorando l‚Äôimpianto costantemente ,vedremo come va nel tempo. In generale  sono soddisfatto.

Julia Ruban ( AIRA energy expert) was a very professional person and could answer all the questions I put to her. She was not a pushy sales person which was very much appreciated. However, I was concerned when  getting a call from a third party to arrange the EPC for my address. I personally would feel that as I am dealing with AIRA; that they should be dealing with this with other companies and speaking to the customer first. The concern in this day and age with scams worried me until I got a call from AIRA to reassure me. I was extremely impressed that Surveyor is arranged and a start date was given to me Within  48 hours of me wishing to proceed. I feel confident that when the conversion is carried out that I will be pressing 5 stars.

After commissioning of our AIRA Heat Pump, there were a few snagging issues. Each of these understandable, particularly since the two main issues may have muddied the path to finding the solution. AIRA engineers were in attendance often and always gave us the time to explain what was wrong and what they were doing to fix it. Sometimes the response after calling the Customer Care line, was not as fast it might have been. However, given that we were among the first batch of installations in the UK, of a new product by a company, which is new to the UK establishing their business here, it is understandable. Out of this experience we have gleaned the following: 1. The local AIRA Hub team openly acknowledge that they have had to fine tune a lot of their understanding of the product and installation processes in a short time 2. Most importantly, the heat pump system is keeping us consistently warm, even now well into November, as the outside temperatures descend well down into single figures. So far we are using significantly less electricity than anticipated. It is therefore looking like our annual heating bill will be significantly less than the nonetheless modern efficient condenser gas boiler that it has replaced. Finally, AIRA have built in features accumulated from their considerable experience in Sweden, where no less than 60% of homes are heated by air source heat pump systems. So we are feeling very comfortable, rather smug at ridding this house of any gas usage at all and above all very happy with the result.
Waren sehr zufriden mit der Beratung und dem Einbau der Anlage. Bis jetzt sind wir sehr zufrieden mit der Anlage . Sind auf den Winter gespannt .

Bereits im Januar 2024 starteten wir mit der  Umsetzung unseres Vorhabens W√§rmepumpe. Aber die Preise von regionalen Anbietern waren schlicht abschreckend. Ab Anfang September dieses Jahres gewann unser lang geplantes Vorhaben ‚ÄûW√§rmepumpe‚Äú  an Dynamik. Am √ºberregionalen Markt tat sich was, die Preise bewegten sich offensichtlich von einem Hoch noch zum Jahresanfang zwischenzeitig eindeutig nach unten. Aus einer erneuten Marktsichtung filterten wir drei  √ºberregionale bzw. internationale Anbieter heraus, die nach Ortsterminen konkurrenzf√§hige Angebote um die 30.000 EUR Marke vorlegten. Geht doch, das Preisniveau sagte uns schon mehr zu.    Nach den Ortsterminen und Vergleich der Angebote kristallisierte sich Aira als der Favorit heraus. Das Angebot f√ºr eine 8 KWh Pumpe entsprach preislich (obwohl nicht ganz der g√ºnstigste) und in seiner Klarheit unseren Erwartungen. Die Ausf√ºhrungen des  Au√üendienstmitarbeiters, Herrn Christian Mayer, untermauerten das Angebot, keine Frage blieb offen, es stellte sich das gute Gef√ºhl ein, sich f√ºr den richtigen L√∂sungsvorschlag und das richtige Unternehmen zu entscheiden. Einen gewichtigen  Teil dazu trugen nat√ºrlich die Aira Zusagen zur Produkt- und Leistungsgarantie √ºber 15 Jahre und dies ohne die (letztlich √ºber 10 oder gar 15 Jahre teure) Vorbedingung Wartungsvertrag. Andere Hersteller versuchten Wartungsvertr√§ge mit sanftem Druck (Garantieverl√§ngerung auf 5 Jahre) mit zu verkaufen, ohne wirklich sagen zu k√∂nnen, worin die j√§hrlichen Wartungsleistungen bestehen. Gleichzeitig wurde in deren Prospekten aber stets hervorgehoben, dass die Anlagen wartungsarm sind. Ein Widerspruch, den keiner so recht aufl√∂sen konnte. Bereits am 18. September unterschrieben wir somit das Angebot von Aira, der Auftrag war entschieden und vergeben.Die Installation unserer W√§rmepumpe startete sehr bald bereits am 21. Oktober mit dem vollen Team. Die Mitarbeiter vom Gala-Bau √ºber den federf√ºhrend und umsichtig handelnden Heizungsbauer Abdula bis hin zum Elektriker, leisteten vier Tage gute Arbeit. Alle Mitarbeiter waren freundlich, umsichtig und mein Heizraum sowie alle Transportwege wurden  sauber verlassen. Am Ende des vierten Tages ging unsere W√§rmepumpe nach √úberwindung kleineren H√ºrden in Betrieb, wir hatten wieder warmes Wasser und die Heizung lief. Lediglich die Steuerung durch die App war noch nicht m√∂glich. Aufgrund personeller Engp√§sse wurde dann die finale Abnahme und Einweisung f√ºr den Montag mit uns vereinbart, die Steuerung erfolgte bis dahin √ºber die Raumthermostate f√ºr die Heizk√∂rper und die Fu√übodenheizung. Am Samstag, dann ein Schreck, die Umw√§lzpumpe f√ºr die Fu√übodenheizung war vermeintlich tot. Wir schalteten den technischen Support von Aira ein, das System lief nach zwei Stunden wie von Geisterhand wieder. Am Montag zeigte die Umw√§lzpumpe abermals kein Lebenszeichen, ein Technikereinsatz wurde auf den Folgetag verschoben. Am Dienstag wurde schlie√ülich festgestellt, dass der Mischer f√ºr die Fu√übodenheizung vermeintliche Ursache f√ºr die zur√ºckliegenden Ausf√§lle war, er wurde auf andere Elektroklemmen gelegt und das System lief wieder. Die Umw√§lzpumpe schien jedoch in der Folge nochmals zweimal auszufallen. Als wir langsam genervt waren, meldete sich ein Systemspezialist, Herr Butzbach, telefonisch aus Berlin bei uns. Er f√ºhrte dabei aus,  er h√§tte alle Werte unserer Anlage abgepr√ºft, sie laufe ganz optimal, das komplette Abschalten der Umw√§lzpumpe w√§re ein gewollter Systemprozess bei entsprechenden Rahmenbedingungen, die Umw√§lzpumpe startet dann bei Bedarf wieder von selbst. Gut, es w√§re sch√∂n gewesen, wenn man uns das etwas fr√ºher gesagt h√§tte. Laut Herrn Butzbach hat aber nur ein begrenzter Kreis von Mitarbeitern die M√∂glichkeit die Betriebsparameter von Anlagen abzurufen und sie dann korrekt zu analysieren.W√§hrend der kompletten Installation und der vorstehend angesprochenen Probleme stand uns  Herr Mayer immer als Ansprechpartner zur Verf√ºgung. Anfragen wurden bei Bedarf sowohl sp√§t abends als auch am Wochenende zeitnah beantwortet. So soll Kundenbetreuung sein, daf√ºr auf jeden Fall f√ºnf Sterne. Da Aira das Versprechen, Installation in weniger als vier Tagen, aufgrund der aufgetretenen Probleme (und deren verz√∂gerte Einordnung) nicht wirklich ganz halten konnte, m√∂chten wir in der Gesamtbewertung nur vier Sterne, aber daf√ºr ehrliche, vergeben.Nun hoffen wir auf viele Jahre Heizbetrieb ohne Probleme, genauso oder gar noch besser, als es in der Vergangenheit mit unserer guten alten Viessmann Mirola gelaufen ist. Es sollte nicht nur ein langer, sondern im R√ºckblick irgendwann auch ein lohnender Weg zu einer Aira W√§rmepumpe gewesen sein.

Met Lee at the Grand Designs show at the NEC in Birmingham in October and Aira seemed to tick the boxes with what we were trying to achieve for our home - solar panels and air source heat pump. Outlined all the possibilities for us with no pressure - we had an initial home survey undertaken which indicated we‚Äôd benefit and our house design lent itself well to the install. We did not follow up on having the work undertaken only due to coincidence with remortgaging and the need to lower monthly outgoings for a favourable rate but we‚Äôll definitely be back in the future to follow up. Lee was great all the way through, very friendly and able to explain how everything worked confidently and without pressure. Will definitely be back!

*Update 4/11/24*Aira have been very good at responding to the issues with our system. We have had a further 3 engineer visits. First, to install the thermostat that wasn't ready during the initial install week. second, was to balance the system which wasn't possible during the install but highlighted a further issue. Third and most significant, was a two day rework of some existing pipework that was causing poor flow to the furthers radiators away from the heat pump. Substantial sections of 15mm plastic pipework was upgraded to 28mm copper pipework. This was a large upgrade that would have cost Aira substantial extra time and money to resolve. I have been very happy with the aftercare I have received both in person, on the phone and via email which has now resolved the system issues. I have now given them 2 extra stars. I would now feel more confidant in recommending Aira.  *Original review*Sales and survey visit were super quick and professional. Installation was professional and clean. The heat pump looks great. Unfortunately they failed to mention they didn't have the indoor wireless thermostat available until the last day of the install. They hadn't finished making them yet apparently. No problem, it comes on when it drops cold outside. Except it doesn't know when the house is warm so doesn't turn itself off! The house is 25'c and costing a fortune to run. The app is the only form of control but lets you control next to nothing. You can't turn the heating or the water on or off, just set water temperature. Even the holiday mode didn't work while we were away. The thermostats are apparently now in the country but I have not heard back from after sales about an install date or a solution to the overheating. I also suspect they drilled through an electrical cable to the house. A ring circuit fault tripped the RCD while we were on holiday meaning we came home to a freezer full of rotten food. an electrician traced the cable break close the new plant room but no firm evidence. But we've had no issue in the house for 10 years and this happened close to the installed location just 1 week after the install. It's early days for the company. I wouldn't right the company off but maybe wait a few months and make sure they have all the hardware available before agreeing an install.
Communication could have been better within the company. Double bookings. That apart great company and customer support.
Good information well presented, looking forward to lower Bill's and more comfortable home temps.

As a freelance product management consultant, staying on top of finances is paramount. I've been using Ruul.io for my invoicing needs and it has significantly eased the process of getting paid promptly. The platform is user-friendly, efficient, and reliable, making it an essential tool in my freelancing toolkit.However, I believe there's an opportunity to elevate its utility by integrating bookkeeping functionalities. I currently use Akaunting for my accounting needs, and an integration between Ruul and Akaunting would streamline my financial management, saving me time and reducing the potential for errors. This would make Ruul not just a good invoicing tool, but a comprehensive financial solution for freelancers like myself.I hope to see this integration in the future and would highly recommend Ruul.io to other freelancers who require dependable and effective invoicing solutions.
